intro: Barbosella fuscata, commonly known as the dark barbosella, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Barbosella fuscata is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to tolerate salt spray and sandy soils.
